headline: Red Potato Salad
description: This red potato salad is made with creamy potatoes and hard-boiled eggs in a seasoned mayo and sour cream dressing for a flavor-packed BBQ side dish.
name: Red Potato Salad
recipeIngredient: 3 pounds red potatoes, cut into chunks

recipeInstructions.text: Place potatoes in a pot with enough water to cover; bring to a boil. Cook until potatoes are easily pierced with a fork, about 10 minutes. Drain, then transfer to a large bowl to cool.

Mix together eggs, sour cream, mayonnaise, celery, green onions, pickle, mustard, vinegar, and hot sauce in a bowl. Season with dill weed, garlic powder, onion salt, salt, and pepper. Pour over potatoes; gently toss to coat.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours before serving.

review.reviewBody: I'm not sure how its possible, but this made me love potato salad even more. Addictively yummy.
The adjust keys didn't work. I halved it exactly. Didn't have green onion, had to use a TB of Vidalia. Thought it tasted wonder.
Just perfect!
I had to double the mayonnaise mixture. I followed the instructions but mine was nothing like the picture.
I always find pickle brine is much better to add instead of vinegar so i will try that
I found my new favorite potato salad. It is really good.
I think this recipe is great. I used regular yellow mustard instead of Dijon and I swapped the amounts of Mayo and sour cream.

I grew up watching my dad make potato salad, and just needed a refresher.
I liked this recipe because I love dill.
However, I am a full-fat woman, and did change the ingredients to reflect this.
It was delicious, either way!

I used half mayo half sour cream as I like thicker sauce. forgot vinegar. 2 stalks celery and 2 green onion. I threw in pimenta as I had some fresh, tbsp. I don't actually like pickle but love it in this. this is a keeper!
Besides adding a bit more pickle (I love them in egg and potato salads) I used the recipe exactly as it was written and it turned out delicious and creamy. Thanks!!!
Great light-tasting potato salad. I did take the suggestion of roasting the potatoes....good call!

This is a healthier way to make a potato salad and it tastes like a baked potato. I used 75% whole Greek yogurt (tastes like sour cream but healthy) and 25% mayo for the basis of the dressing. Used dill pickle juice instead of vinegar, fresh dill instead of dried, and added crumbled bacon. Light tasting and delicious!

Wow how easy was this and taste Fantastic. Some German red potato salad can be overbearing. This was just right. Went well with my BBQ chicken slow-cooked in the crock. I made strawberry shortcake for dessert.
A nice twist to your regular potato salad. I Used the Greek yogurt and a little bit of mayo too. I should have put a little bit more hot sauce into the blend.
It was excellent & I will definitely make it again. A completely different taste from our usual potato salad. No need to make changes.
Excellent!!! I will be making this again.
Excellent!!! I will be making this again.
Delicious!

Made half a recipe subbing spicy brown mustard for Dijon, red wine vinegar for white vinegar, onion powder for onion salt and minced fresh garlic for garlic powder. Added 1 tsp Diamond Krystal kosher salt leaving everything else the same, and it was absolutely delicious. Also cooked the potatoes and eggs in an Instant Pot for 4 minutes on high followed by quick release. Will definitely be making this again.
I like things spicy so I added red pepper flakes , I also didn't have celery so I used celery flakes & had a red onion to use up so sub green onion with it

Awesome red potato salad. It was a hit. I doubled it and I roasted the potatoes as one reviewer recommended. I made the rest of the recipe as is. Everyone loved it and had several requests for the recipe.
I did roast the potatoes as another reviewer suggested. Turned out great!
Yummy - followed recipe as is.
Love the Tabasco sauce, gives it flavor but not the heat! Made it for Father's Day cook out. Yum!

Hooray! A delicious and fairly easy potato salad, far superior to that store-bought soupy, greasy glop. I try to make a batch every Friday in the summer so I have some to go alongside the inevitable grilled fare on the weekend. Full disclosure: I roast the potatoes as suggested by others.
Really good! I put capers, more pickles, more celery and one extra egg in it...so not boring and will make it again soon!

pretty good recipe. I felt like it was missing something. It definitely needed more salt than the recipe called for. The dill taste is nice, but it could have used more of a kick to really make the whole dish be more memorable. One batch goes a very long way.
Simple to make easy and delicious
This was just ok. Will not make again.

I steamed the potato until the skins were peeling of which gave it a slight mashed potato fluffiness
I used olive oil mayo and two extra eggs (I love eggs in my potato salad)
I didn't have celery so left it out. Though about pickles but wanted a creamier flavor.
everything else was hand poured though having 30+ years of making I was pretty much spot on.
My husband loved it and the next day I added bacon and heated it up with some Parmesan as a hot dish and now we are too full to move!
This was a great recipe and such easy directions that I could alter it and not go wrong! Loved it!
I will make again! Creamy, enjoyed the taste!
I used regular sour cream and regular mayo. Very good!
I made this for an end of summer BBQ. Everyone loved it and is asking for the recipe!
Delish. Mine needed a lot of salt even though I salted the water when boiling the potatoes.

Start of a great recipe but this was very bland, like others I tripled the spices - you can't expect dashes and half teaspoons to do anything notable in 3 lbs of taters. A package of bacon crumbled into it helped it out a lot too.
It’s a little bland. But very creamy......I just need to add some more onion and maybe mustard.
I made this yesterday for a birthday party and it was a hit! I will make it again.
I’m not a mustard fan and was happy to find this recipe. Really delicious and will make again. Instead of all mayo, I did 1/2 Greek yogurt—really like the little sour punch it gave.

I made it and it turned out great! I would use less mayonnaise and more sour cream next time. I didn't have dill, so I used chopped flat leaf parsley and a little cilantro. I also used more celery and scallions than it called for. It was so good, I made it twice!
It was so yummy
This was amazing. So much flavor and creaminess. I can’t wait to make this again.
No changes, won't make again
Very good. None left.
Yes. It was excellent and I will make it again.
reminds me of my moms patato salad. its awesome :)

I really wanted to like this potato salad more than I did. I made it as stated and was so disappointed by how much it lacked in flavor. I had to do a lot of doctoring to make it flavorful. As a base recipe it would be fine.
Beutiful potatoe salad

decent proportions & a good place to start!
As per other reviews, I too, tweaked the recipe:
up all the spices about 3-4 times
2 tbs dijon
same "liquids"
1 tsp dill
regular sour cream
Very good recipe. I used greek yogurt instead of sour cream and had no dill pickle but did have dill pickle juice so I used that instead of vinegar, added a bit more celery to replace missing pickle.
Made this as posted. It was awesome. Will definitely make again.

This was pretty good if you like dill which I do. I will definitely make it again. It was pretty easy to make for me and I am a beginning cook. It made a lot so next time I make it I will half the recipe. I put in a little more celery in mine because I like celery.

I've made this several times and always get rave reviews. I up the mustard because I like the tang and have separately used green onions and red onions due to supply and both came out delicious. I add crumbled bacon on top before serving. Lovely!

Very tasty! I used full fat versions of the mayo and sour cream and added another 1/2 tbsp vinegar to brighten it up. The veg, herb, and spice mix was spot on. Per other writers, it did need some liberal salting. A helpful tip I stole from making pasta is to cool the potatoes on lightly oiled baking sheets, where I also started the salt/pepper additions. One last tweak was to use 1/2 chopped dill pickles and 1/2 sweet pickle relish. Great recipe, thanks!
Not what I expected. Could taste the dill and sour cream not the mayo

Brought this to a pool party/ birthday party and my family raved about it. I am always nervous when bringing a new dish for a test flight, but it was such a hit I was asked to bring it to the next birthday party the following weekend!
We use plain greek yogurt (male with whole milk rather than fat free) in place of sour cream for everything, so I subbed it here also. I increased the celery too a little, because I tend to not chop my ingredients very finely. 
It was so good! Can't wait to have it again next week!
Excellent lighter tasting choice
Great blend of ingredients and seasonings.
No changes and I'll make it again

Very good recipe. I didn't add the pickle because I didn't think I would like the taste of pickle in potato salad nor did I add the hot sauce. Other than that followed the recipe and it was great. This will be my go-to potato salad recipe from now on.

I had never made potato salad before...crazy, I know, because I love potato salad. Anyway, I made a double batch of this for a family birthday barbecue and it was completely gone! Everyone raved about it. My sister just asked me to make it for our Labor Day cookout. 

I didn't have any green onion, so had replaced it with diced vidalia onion, which I soaked in water for a bit prior to using. I was also using organic celery from my farm co-op and the stalks were tiny with lots of greens. I included the greens and used best judgement on how much of the celery to use. 

Hoping I can repeat what I did last time when I make it today!! Great recipe, though! Even if you've never made it before.
This was a huge hit at a potluck. People even grabbed all the leftovers to go. I opted for nonfat plain Greek yogurt as suggested and I was very liberal with the seasonings. Awesome!
Great recipe! I made if as is for several BBQ's recently and it was a big hit! The only thing I omitted were the eggs. (Gotta watch my colesterol!)

I didn't have any onion salt, light mayo, nor Dijon mustard on hand, so I substituted celery salt, Kraft mayo with olive oil, and Horseradish mustard. I think it tastes great! I especially like how it doesn't taste like there is a ton of mayonnaise in it. I would make this again.
it was missing something. I think i like it with more mayo and less spur cream. it was ok.

I loved it. The only thing I changed was I didn't have sour cream. I used mayo. Delicious. Next time I will make using sour cream. This salad is really tasty. Thank you for sharing this. This recipe is a KEEPER!

I added fresh dill weed and added hot dog relish that has mustard in it since I didn't have anythjng in hand. 
It came out great.
Very good. I added a bit more dill, mustard, and onion powder, also a pound of crispy bacon. Served with grilled ribs this is a great summer dish!
added Cayenne pepper . brown spicy mustard . extra egg.bacon Yummy
Used a tablespoon of sweet relish instead of pickle because I didn't have any. Pretty good flavor, but probably won't make again.
Can't wait to make it again. I added canned chicken to make it a meal
I omit vinegar and hot sauce, and less eggs. My kids love it!

Turned out very well. Modified based on ingredients on hand, didn't have pickles and did not substitute. I only had yellow mustard so only used half amount called for. I made it the night before the cookout and it went over extremely well.
Absolutely not its perfect the way it is and it. Is now one of the family favorites thank you !!!!!!
Pretty bland for all the different ingredients.
Very tasty, light and creamy. Added some red seedless grapes because it is so hot outside right now.

such simple and yummy recipe! my family loved it! and my husband normally dislikes potato salad. we were out of onions so I used extra celery and it worked out great! we used fat free sour cream and low fat mayo and I added some bacon. we didn't have any hot sauce so I added a lil cayenne pepper and this turned out delicious!! JUST A TIP (I had read another review with this tip and since this was only my second time making potato salad I wasn't aware of this tip and it was helpful!): make the sauce in advance and let sit in the fridge and the flavors become stronger and disperse. when I first made it I thought it was a lil bland and was going to add more, but listened to the tip and let it sit in the fridge while the potatoes cooled too. when I finally mixed it all together it was PERFECT! had I added more it would've been too flavorful. im a picky potato salad eater, and find most home made ones disgusting...but this one was fantastic! thanks for the recipe!! :) we plan on making it bi-weekly!

Great recipe, I have a tough audience and everyone liked it. To make it even lighter, I used low-fat Greek yogurt instead of sour cream, and I used Lawry's Fire Roasted Chile and Garlic powder. Be sure to use Clausen refrigerated dill pickles. The chile/garlic powder gives the salad a slight but alluring smokey flavour, and the dill pickles, celery, and yogurt keep it fresh and light.
Enjoyed the sour cream/mayo combination. Everyone came back for more.
Love this recipe. It's fresh and perfect for a side dish especially in the summer.

This a good building block and I would encourage you to make it your own as I did. As is, you got the makings of a good potato salad. Everyone recalls that Mom's tater salad is the best, and mine is no exception. But I like this one. Things I did different? Added more egg, celery, changed the ratio of sour cream and mayo. Used a Thai chili sauce and added crushed garlic and onion. Except for the potatoes, I minced everything tiny, just like my Mom did. I hate chunks in my salad. Anyways, enjoy!

This is so yummy and great for us that count fat grams and calories. I actually cut the potatoes and eggs in half but forgot to gut the dill in half. Oh well still yummy great recipe thanks so much!!!
This turned out great i even omitted the eggs since I had vegetarian guests and it was still very flavorful.
This is by far the best potato salad on this site. Pretty much everyone "doctor's up" their salad in their own way anyways, but this one is awesome as is!
I love it! Nice change from regular potato salad. Yumm!
Loved this recipe, I only increased the amount of green onions and celery. Big hit with our guests. Will never make my old boring potato salad again!
This is my go to potato salad now. I absolutely love this recipe, it's so light & refreshing. Thanks for sharing.
Good base for a salad, but it needed more seasoning. For our taste, more mustard or hot sauce could be added to balance the sweetness of the mixture.
Good recipe! Though I added chopped mini sweet peppers, and a bit of pickle brine. And fresh dill.

Will definitely make this again. Turned out really well. I will add another pickle or two next time and found 3 lbs of potatoes wasn't enough for 12 servings but I had big eaters. I will feel better next time using 5 lbs and increasing rest of ingredients accordingly.

this is a fantastic recipe. I didn't use yogurt and I didn't use lite mayo. I don't use diet anything. I used just sour cream and mayo a touch of apple cider vinegar and a touch of sugar. My husband loved it and said the best potato salad I had ever made. Can't wait to make again. thanks for the great recipe.
Wonderful and a big hit with the family!! It's my go-to potato salad. Used 1 less egg than recipe calls for and 1 extra potato. Perfect as I prefer my potato salad a bit less eggy.
This is fabulous!!! I veganized it by using vegan sour cream and vegan mayonnaise. I left out the boiled eggs and it was heavenly. Love it, love it, love it. I'll be making this often.

This recipe was delicious -- just what I was looking for. I wanted something with sour cream in the dressing since I served the salad with buffalo chicken burgers (spicy). I left out the egg and pickles, but otherwise kept it the same. I agree that if you can make it ahead and leave it in the fridge overnight it makes the flavors blend better.

I took this to a family gathering and everyone really liked it. I made a few minor changes because of item availability. Used dill relish instead of vinegar & chopped pickle, no hot sauce or dill weed, purple onion instead of green, and I added chopped red peppers.

This is great potato salad. I have an old standby that I usually make, but thought it would be fun to try something different and I wasn't sorry that I chose this one. I cut the recipe in half (didn't want a huge amount in case I didn't like it) but otherwise followed the recipe exactly. My dash of hot sauce was more of a glug, but I like the spice. I definitely like using less mayo. I think I will use the dressing recipe even on my old standby recipe.

As a vegetarian, I consider myself a pretty good cook but have never been able to master potato salad until I tried this one! I used finely chopped yellow onion and dried celery flakes in lieu of green onion and celery. I also replaced the sour cream with plain Greek yogurt. I was a bit skeptical about using a dash of hot sauce but it really works. I couldn't stop eating it!
Yes, I did this one the other night and let me tell you...I loved it and so did the rest of the family. I didn't change a thing - keeping this one in my recipe box. thank u :)

Thanks for a great potato salad recipe! I had never tried red potato salad mostly because of tradition and I usually don't buy red potatoes. This year I joined a CSA (community supported agriculture) program and received many new or untried veggies through this program. The last few weeks we have gotten red potatoes as part of our bounty. I cooked them with green beans in the crock pot (love my crock pot) from a recipe found here. Yesterday, I wanted potato salad and had more red potatoes so I did a search and came up with several but this one used low-fat ingredients so it caught my eye. I omitted onion salt and celery because I didn't have on hand. The dill pickles add a surprise taste. My husband and I both loved it. I will be making again!
We enjoyed this very much! I omitted the eggs and used pickle relish instead of pickle. Will make again and maybe add crispy bacon! Good flavor, nice change from traditional potato salad!!'
